howOvertimeCalculatorWorks: This Ireland overtime pay calculator determines your take-home overtime earnings by applying standard Irish tax rates. The calculator then computes the gross overtime pay and deducts PAYE tax, PRSI, and USC using Ireland's progressive tax system. Results show both the gross overtime amount and your net take-home pay from overtime work.

faqs.question: How is overtime taxed in Ireland?
faqs.answer: Overtime pay in Ireland is taxed at the same rates as regular income, including PAYE income tax, PRSI employee contributions, and Universal Social Charge (USC). There's no special tax treatment for overtime earnings.

faqs.question: What's time-and-a-half and double time?
faqs.answer: Time-and-a-half means 1.5 times your regular hourly rate. Double time means 2 times your regular rate. These are common overtime multipliers in Ireland, though actual rates depend on your employment contract.

faqs.question: Are there limits on overtime hours?
faqs.answer: Irish law limits overtime to 48 hours per week on average over a 4-month period. Anything beyond this may require special permission and could affect tax treatment.

faqs.question: How do I calculate overtime hours?
faqs.answer: Overtime is typically hours worked beyond your standard working week. In Ireland, this is usually 35-40 hours per week depending on your contract. Check your employment agreement for exact overtime definitions.

faqs.question: Is overtime pay included in my tax credits?
faqs.answer: Yes, overtime pay is included in your total taxable income and counts toward tax credits and rate bands. It doesn't receive special tax treatment.
